title: 8.4 Fast food - hv12
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollecties voor Engels voor havo en vwo, leerjaar 1 en 2. Dit is thema 8 'Food and drink'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: Fast food. In deze les staat fastfood centraal waarbij gekeken wordt naar wat fastfood is (bijv. crispy fried chicken, behandeld in de luisteropdracht) en het verschil tussen ongezond en gezond eten. In de schrijfopdracht wordt dit laatste behandeld door te kijken naar wat voor gezond eten en wat voor ongezond eten er in de schoolkantine wordt verkocht. De grammaticaopdracht is een grammaticatoets van de in dit thema besproken onderwerpen.

items.content:
The subject of this double period is fast food.

  • Make groups of three or four.
  • Discuss these questions in English with your group:
    • Do you eat a lot of fast food? What is your favourite?
    • Does your school cafeteria offer fast food?
    • How do you feel about that?
    • What do you think your cafeteria should sell that it doesn't already?
    • Make a list of 15-20 healthy and unhealthy things that you can buy in your school cafeteria.

Step

activity

aim

time

introduction

Find out what you already know.

10

Step 1

listening
How to make crispy fried chicken

You can understand a video about preparing fried chicken and answer questions.

15

Step 2

reading
Fast food

You can understand a text about fast food and answer questions.

15

Step 3

vocabulary

You can understand and use vocabulary about fast food.

15

Step 4

grammar
Grammar test

You can understand and use the present simple, the present continuous, past participles and possessive pronouns.

15

Step 5

speaking
A speech about fast food

You can give a speech about fast food in the school cafeteria.

10

Step 6

writing
A letter about fast food

You can write a letter to your parents about fast food.

15

Step 7

evaluation

Reflecting on what you have learnt.

05

How to make crispy fried chicken

You are going to watch a video in which someone explains how to make your own crispy fried chicken.

  • Watch the video.
  • While watching, think about these questions:
    • Do you think this home-made version is healthier than crispy fried chicken from a fast food restaurant?
    • If you could change anything about the recipe, what would it be?

questions.label: Oefening 1: How to make crispy fried chicken

prompt.body:
Make notes.
For this recipe, you need 7 ingredients. Note them down.
For an extra challenge, add the correct amounts.

values.value:
1. flour (two cups)
  2. paprika (one teaspoon)
  3. salt (to taste)
  4. pepper (to taste)
  5. buttermilk (1 cup)
  6. 1 cut-up chicken (4 pounds)
  7. vegetable oil (up to 2 quarts)

  6. 1 cut-up chicken (4 pounds)
  7. vegetable oil (up to 2 quarts)

prompt.body: 1. Hoeveel kopjes bloem worden er in het recept gebruikt?
2. Hoeveel zout en peper moet je gebruiken?

prompt.body: 3. Wat kun je doen als je geen karnemelk hebt?

content.body: in plaats daarvan zure melk gebruiken

prompt.body: 4. Wat moet je doen om te zorgen dat het hele stuk kip met bloem bedekt wordt?

content.body: het met een tang goed erdoorheen halen

prompt.body: 5. Wanneer kun je de kip gaan frituren?

content.body: als alle extra bloem eraf is gevallen
als de bloem op een pasta is gaan lijken
als de kip op kamertemperatuur is

prompt.body: 6. Hoe heet moet de olie zijn?
7. Hoe lang moet je de kip frituren?
8. Hoe zorg je dat de kip krokant blijft als je hem opwarmt?

content.body: door hem onder een theedoek te laten liggen
door hem in de oven op te warmen
door hem opnieuw te frituren in olie

items.content:
Fast food

You are going to read a text about fast food.

  • Read the text.
  • While reading, think about these questions:
    • What happens in the USA that doesn't happen here?
    • How do you feel about that?

Fast food

1 Fast food is cheap, easy and quick. Fast food companies spend millions of dollars each year trying to make young people believe that fast food is cool. The average American eats three burgers and four orders of French fries a week. Is it any wonder that 14% of American teenagers are obese?

2 It's fine to eat fast food occasionally as part of a healthy diet. But fast food is high in fat and calories, so if your favourite meal is a burger and fries, you could easily become obese. Obesity could lead to other diseases such as diabetes, heart disease and arthritis.

3 There's no escape from fast food for American teens. Fast food companies give money to US schools to help them buy sports and computer equipment. In return, schools place advertisements for the fast food companies in their hallways and on the sides of their school buses. Fast food companies also sell cheap fast food in school cafeterias and sponsor school books.

4 You might say: but you don't have to order fast food, you can choose a healthier option. However, studies show that adverts in and around schools affect the food choices students make in the school cafeteria. Even students whose parents were trying to teach them healthy eating habits were influenced. That means that fast food companies are undermining parents' efforts to keep their children healthy. It also undermines nutrition education.

5 Now, America is starting to fight back against the fast food companies. The two biggest states in the US, California and Texas, may stop serving fast food and soda in school cafeterias. The American government may bring in special laws for preventing and treating obesity.


Do the exercises.

prompt.body:
Which title best fits the paragraphs?
There is one extra title. Combine it with the 'Prullenbak'.

content.body:
Are these statements true or false?

1. A lot of money is spent on advertising for fast food. True / False
2. The writer wonders if it's really true that 14% of American teenagers are obese. True / False
3. It's OK to eat fast food, as long as you don't do it too often. True / False
4. American schools get money in exchange for advertising fast food. True / False
5. Most students aren't affected by fast food advertising in school. True / False
6. The influence of parents and food education programmes is very limited. True / False
7. California and Texas are the states with the most advertising for fast food. True / False
8. It's possible that the government is going to make laws to make sure kids don't become overweight anymore. True / False

items.content:
• Study the vocabulary. (10 minutes)
  • Do the exercise.

Woordenlijst Fast food hv12

content.body:
Which word fits the description?

  1. not expensive
  2. sticks of potato fried in oil
  3. give the food they ordered to customers
  4. let something liquid flow into, for example, a pan
  5. another word for the verb 'influence'
  6. another word for 'sickness'
  7. with herbs, spices, salt and pepper
  8. another word for 'fast'

Which word fits the description?

  1. put something from one side onto the other
  2. a flat pan to fry things in
  3. not a problem
  4. crunchy like, for example, potato chips
  5. the place at school where they sell food and drinks
  6. a group of things made at the same time
  7. make something cold hot again
  8. put another ingredient into a dish

items.content:
In de afgelopen blokken heb je kennisgemaakt met het voltooid deelwoord en bezittelijke voornaamwoorden. Ook heb je meer geleerd over het verschil tussen de present simple en de present continuous. Weet je nog hoe het zat?

Bestudeer uit de Kennisbank de onderdelen Present simple of present continuous, Voltooid deelwoord en Bezittelijk voornaamwoord nog een keer.
Present simple of present continuous?
Voltooid deelwoord
Bezittelijk voornaamwoord

prompt.body:
Choose the correct possessive pronoun.

1. That book belongs to Mia. It is ... .

Choose the correct possessive pronoun.

2. That house belongs to us. It is ... house.

Choose the correct possessive pronoun.

3. This jacket belongs to me. It is ... .

content.body:
Fill in the correct past participle (voltooid deelwoord).

4. We haven't (to see) Riccardo in ages.

Fill in the correct past participle (voltooid deelwoord).

5. I could have (to dance) all night!

Fill in the correct past participle (voltooid deelwoord).

6. This phone is (to make) in China.

Fill in the correct form of the verb. Choose between the present simple and the present continuous.

7. Where is your brother? - In his room. He (to play) a video game.

Fill in the correct form of the verb. Choose between the present simple and the present continuous.

8. My sister (to eat) a salad for lunch every day.

Fill in the correct form of the verb. Choose between the present simple and the present continuous.

9. I (not - to eat) meat. I'm a vegetarian.

Fill in the correct form of the verb. Choose between the present simple and the present continuous.

10. (I - to click) my pen again? I'm sorry! I'll stop now.

items.content:
A speech about fast food

You are going to give a speech about banning fast food from the school cafeteria. Use the description below.

Preparation

  • First, decide whether you are in favour of a ban or against it.
  • Research and note down at least three arguments.
  • Write down a couple of words and phrases to help you in your speech.
  • Pay special attention to the correct use of the present simple, the present continuous and possessive pronouns.

Giving your speech

  • Find two or three other classmates to work with.
  • Give your speech.
  • Ask your classmates to write down feedback for you.
  • Next, let them give their speeches and write down feedback for them. Pay special attention to the correct use of the present simple, the present continuous and possessive pronouns.
  • Discuss what went well and what you can do better next time.

Het bestuur van je school overweegt de verkoop van fastfoodproducten in de schoolkantine te verbieden. Ze willen de mening horen van de leerlingen en vragen hun daarom een kort praatje te komen houden waarin ze hun mening geven en beargumenteren. Jij besluit mee te doen.

  • Geef je mening: ben je voor of tegen?
  • Ondersteun je mening met twee argumenten.
  • Vertel iets over je eigen eetgewoonten op school en welke invloed het aanbod in de kantine daarop heeft.
  • Sluit af met een duidelijke conclusie.

A letter about fast food

Write a letter to your parents about fast food. Use the description below.

Je ouders hebben besloten dat er geen fastfood meer het huis in komt. Maar jij houdt juist zo van een frietje of een pizza op z'n tijd! Alleen: je durft het niet in een gesprek aan te kaarten omdat je wel zeker weet dat al je argumenten zó onder tafel zullen worden geveegd. Daarom ga je een brief schrijven om te proberen hen van gedachten te doen veranderen.

In je brief:

  • vertel je hoe je over hun beslissing denkt;
  • geef je minstens één argument vóór het (af en toe) eten van fastfood;
  • vertel je wat je favoriete fastfood is en waarom je het zo lekker vindt;
  • zet je in op een compromis: in plaats van af te halen, zouden jullie het zelf kunnen maken;
  • doe je een paar suggesties om jouw favoriete fastfood nét iets gezonder te maken.
  • Sluit je brief netjes af.

What have you learnt in this double period?
Answer the following questions:

  • What was the easiest part of this lesson?
  • What did you already know?
  • What was the most difficult part?
  • What was new to you in this lesson?
  • Are there things you don't quite understand yet? How are you going to deal with them?
  • What do you need to ask your teacher?
